intro: Pilosella rhodantha, commonly known as the red-haired weed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, giving it its common name, and produces small yellow flowers that develop into achene fruits. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. Pilosella rhodantha is a perennial herb that spreads through both seeds and rhizomes.
